DOC.brief_summary: Randomized trial grocery-store base nutrition counsel visit weight management vs. in-office visit . The investigator test pre- post-intervention individual-level dietary quality , knowledge , self-efficacy around dietary choice , cost shopping , measure difference intervention control arm . At study 's end , investigator also conduct focus group subset 20 patient ( 10 arm ) structure interview dietitian good understand feasibility , strengths shortcoming approach . Patients complete main portion trial randomly select recruitment focus group consent separately focus group end study . The investigator hypothesize , compare office-based visit , KP Personal Shopper visit result high member diet quality score , good nutritional knowledge score , high self-efficacy confidence around food purchasing decision , favorable perception visit dietician member . The KP Personal Shopper approach may also result increased grocery store cost member . Long-term , investigator hypothesize improvement member perception , knowledge dietary quality lead improve health outcome .
DOC.brief_title: The KP Personal Shopper : A Pilot Improve Impact Dietary Advice
DOC.criteria: Employee population specific Southeastern U.S. County 1864 year age Body Mass Index great equal 30kg/m^2 ( Obese ) Low rate noshows office visit ( < 10 % ) Saw PCP provider past 12 month Does least 50 % food shopping and/or food preparation household nonEnglish speaking Currently treat cancer ( nonmelanoma skin cancer ) Pregnant plan pregnancy next 6 month Had consider bariatric surgery Currently participate commercial weight loss program ( e.g . Jenny Craig ) Currently enrol another weight management nutrition study
